page.title: 16Robbery at Erbistock PO
page.content: Most of the village of Erbistock is in this block, but the village shop is 750 m North on the A539. This shop is a general store and post office. On 25th August 1983 two youths entered the shop enquiring about riding gear. As the sub-postmaster turned his back to fetch a riding jacket, one of the youths held a knife to his back and told him to empty the till. Whilst doing this he signalled to his wife to go and telephone the police. The police erected road blocks and when the youths were leaving they apprehended them. The sub-postmaster was subsequently awarded a certificate of bravery which he now proudly displays in his shop.
